        Convert an instance of InputStream to a FSDataInputStream that is Seekable and PositionedReadable.

        java.io.IOException
        See Also:

      • copy

        public static long copy(java.io.InputStream is,
                        java.io.OutputStream os)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Copies an InputStream to and OutputStream using Channels.

        Note: The method does not close the InputStream and OutputStream. However, the ReadableByteChannel and WritableByteChannels are closed

        Returns:
        Total bytes copied
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • copy

        public static long copy(java.nio.channels.ReadableByteChannel inputChannel,
                        java.nio.channels.WritableByteChannel outputChannel)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Copies a ReadableByteChannel to a WritableByteChannel.

        Note: The ReadableByteChannel and WritableByteChannels are NOT closed by the method

        Returns:
        Total bytes copied
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • tar

        public static void tar(org.apache.hadoop.fs.FileSystem fs,
                       org.apache.hadoop.fs.Path sourcePath,
                       org.apache.hadoop.fs.Path destPath)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a tar gzip file using a given Path as input and a given Path as a destination. If the given input is a file then only that file will be added to tarball. If it is a directory then the entire directory will be recursively put into the tarball.
        Parameters:
        fs - the FileSystem the input exists, and the the output should be written to.
        sourcePath - the Path of the input files, this can either be a file or a directory.
        destPath - the Path that tarball should be written to.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • tar

        public static void tar(org.apache.hadoop.fs.FileSystem sourceFs,
                       org.apache.hadoop.fs.FileSystem destFs,
                       org.apache.hadoop.fs.Path sourcePath,
                       org.apache.hadoop.fs.Path destPath)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Similiar to tar(FileSystem, Path, Path) except the source and destination FileSystem can be different.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        See Also:
        #tar(FileSystem, Path, Path)}
